title: Medicine
description: Ozone therapy and ozonation in medicine: sterilization of operating rooms and wards, disinfection of medical equipment, treatment of dental offices, rehabilitation centers and ambulances.

hospitals.title: Hospitals and operating rooms
hospitals.shortDesc: Sterilization of wards and operating blocks
hospitals.content:
Hospital ozonation provides the highest level of sterility, critical for preventing nosocomial infections. Ozone destroys bacteria, viruses, spores and fungi with up to 99.99% efficiency.

Operating blocks require special sanitary regimes. Ozonation after surgery ensures deep disinfection of all surfaces, including hard-to-reach areas: equipment crevices, ventilation systems, ceiling fixtures.

ICU and resuscitation wards are high-risk zones for infection transmission between patients. Regular ozonation reduces microbial load in the air and on surfaces, complementing standard cleaning protocols.

Ozone is effective against antibiotic-resistant bacteria, including MRSA and VRE, which pose a serious threat in healthcare. After treatment, ozone decays to oxygen with no toxic residues, which is important for patient safety.

intro.text: Nosocomial infections (HAI) are one of the most serious problems in modern medicine. According to WHO, 7-10% of hospitalized patients in developed countries and up to 25% in developing countries are infected. Ozonation is an effective method to combat this problem, ensuring pathogen destruction at 99.99%.
intro.text2: Unlike chemical disinfectants, ozone leaves no toxic residues, does not cause resistance in microorganisms, and decays to pure oxygen within 20-30 minutes after treatment. This is especially important for patients with weakened immunity.

highlight1.title: Important:
highlight1.text: Ozone is effective against antibiotic-resistant bacterial strains, including MRSA (methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus) and VRE (vancomycin-resistant enterococci), which pose a particular threat in healthcare facilities.

problem.title: The problem of nosocomial infections
problem.text: Nosocomial infections increase hospitalization time by an average of 8-10 days, increase treatment costs and increase mortality. Main sources of HAI:
items: Contact surfaces: beds, bedside tables, handrails, call buttons
Medical equipment: monitors, catheters, breathing circuits
Air environment: aerosol particles from coughing, sneezing, medical procedures
Ventilation and air conditioning systems
Textiles: bed linens, curtains, gowns

operating-rooms.title: Ozonation of operating blocks
operating-rooms.text: Operating blocks require special sanitary regimes. Traditional cleaning with disinfectants cannot ensure treatment of all surfaces — ozone, being a gas, penetrates equipment crevices, ventilation systems, hard-to-reach areas behind devices.
operating-rooms.highlight: After ozonation, 1.5-2 hours of ventilation is sufficient to reduce ozone concentration to a safe level. The room is ready for use without additional treatment.

wards.title: Disinfection of wards and ICUs
wards.text: Intensive care and resuscitation wards are zones with increased risk of infection transmission between patients. The most vulnerable categories are here: patients on mechanical ventilation, after surgery, with immunodeficiency.

steps.title: Room preparation
steps.description: Removal of patients (if possible) or use of isolated zones. Closing windows and doors, turning off supply ventilation.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Turning on the ozonator for the calculated time. Concentration of 15-20 mg/m³ ensures destruction of most pathogens.

steps.title: Exposure
steps.description: Maintaining the set concentration for 30-60 minutes for complete disinfection of all surfaces.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: Opening ventilation, airing the room until ozone concentration drops below MAC (0.1 mg/m³).

pathogens.title: Effectiveness against pathogens
pathogens.text: Ozone destroys almost all types of pathogenic microorganisms found in healthcare facilities:

table.caption: Pathogen inactivation time by ozone (concentration 20 mg/m³)

features.title: No resistance
features.description: Ozone acts on cell membranes — bacteria cannot develop resistance

features.title: Full coverage
features.description: Gas penetrates everywhere: into crevices, behind equipment, into ventilation, under furniture

features.title: No residues
features.description: Decays to oxygen — no rinsing required, safe for patients

features.title: Compliance with regulations
features.description: Method recommended by Russian sanitary standards for healthcare facilities

safety.title: Safety requirements
safety.text: When ozonating medical premises, safety requirements must be observed:
items: Treatment is carried out in the absence of people and animals
The room must be sealed during treatment
Staff working with ozonators must undergo training
After treatment — mandatory ventilation to MAC (0.1 mg/m³)
Use of ozone concentration sensors is recommended
Keeping a treatment log for control and reporting
safety.warning: MAC of ozone in the work zone is 0.1 mg/m³. When exceeded, a characteristic "after thunderstorm" smell is felt. Modern ozonators are equipped with timers and automatic shutdown systems.

equipment-sterilization.title: Medical equipment sterilization
equipment-sterilization.heroText: Low-temperature ozone sterilization of endoscopes, plastic products and electronics. Complete treatment of heat-sensitive medical equipment without damage.
equipment-sterilization.content:
Ozone is used to sterilize medical equipment that cannot be treated with high temperatures or harsh chemicals: endoscopes, plastic items, electronics, optics.

Low-temperature ozone sterilization is an alternative to autoclaving for heat-sensitive equipment. The process runs at 25–35°C and 80–90% relative humidity, which is safe for most materials.

Endoscopic equipment is especially demanding. Complex construction with narrow channels creates a risk of incomplete treatment by traditional methods. Ozone gas penetrates all cavities and channels for full sterilization.

The ozone sterilization cycle includes: pre-humidification, exposure in ozone atmosphere for 30–60 minutes, and degassing. The method is validated for use in healthcare and meets sterilization standards.

intro.text: Modern medical equipment often contains heat-sensitive materials: plastic, electronics, optics that cannot be sterilized in an autoclave. Ozone sterilization is an effective alternative operating at 25-35°C.
intro.text2: Ozone is a powerful oxidizer that destroys bacteria, viruses, spores and fungi by breaking down cell membranes. At the same time, it leaves no toxic residues and decomposes into oxygen within 20-30 minutes after treatment.

highlight1.title: Important:
highlight1.text: Traditional steam sterilization at 121-134°C damages plastic products, electronics and optics. Ozone sterilization allows processing these materials without risk of deformation or failure.

problem.title: Medical equipment sterilization problems
problem.text: Medical equipment requires sterilization after each use. But not all methods are suitable for all types of products:
items: Autoclaving: high temperature damages plastic and electronics
Ethylene oxide: toxic, requires long degassing (up to 12 hours)
Plasma sterilization: high equipment cost
Chemical solutions: metal corrosion, seal damage
Radiation sterilization: expensive, not suitable for daily use

endoscopes.title: Endoscope sterilization
endoscopes.text: Endoscopes are complex devices with narrow channels, optics and electronics. Their sterilization is a special task that ozone solves effectively.
endoscopes.highlight: Ozone penetrates channels with diameter from 1 mm, ensuring sterilization of areas inaccessible to liquid disinfectants. This is critical for preventing nosocomial infections.

lowtemp.title: Low-temperature sterilization process
lowtemp.text: The ozone sterilization cycle consists of several stages, each important for achieving complete sterility:

steps.title: Pre-humidification
steps.description: Bringing humidity in the chamber to 80-90%. Moisture enhances the bactericidal action of ozone and ensures its penetration into micropores.

steps.title: Ozone saturation
steps.description: Ozone supply to concentration of 40-80 ppm. The gas is evenly distributed throughout the chamber and penetrates all equipment cavities.

steps.title: Exposure
steps.description: Holding at specified concentration for 30-60 minutes. During this time, ozone destroys cell membranes of all microorganisms.

steps.title: Degassing
steps.description: Removal of residual ozone from the chamber. Ozone decomposes into oxygen in 15-20 minutes. Equipment is ready for use.

materials.title: Compatible materials
materials.text: Ozone sterilization is safe for most materials used in medical equipment:

features.title: Plastics and polymers
features.description: Polyethylene, polypropylene, polycarbonate, PVC — not damaged during ozone sterilization

features.title: Electronics
features.description: Boards, sensors, displays, endoscope cameras — safe treatment without static voltage

features.title: Optics
features.description: Lenses, light guides, prisms — ozone does not affect optical properties of elements

features.title: Metals and alloys
features.description: Stainless steel, titanium, aluminum — resistant to ozone at standard concentrations

benefits.title: Benefits for healthcare facilities
items: Sterilization of heat-sensitive equipment without damage
Fast processing cycle — high instrument turnover
No toxic residues — patient safety
Low operating cost — minimum consumables
Penetration into hard-to-reach places — complete channel sterilization
Compliance with medical device sterilization standards
benefits.warning: When working with ozonators, safety precautions must be observed: ozone is toxic when inhaled. Sterilization chambers must be sealed. Ozone MAC in the work area is 0.1 mg/m³.

dental.title: Dental clinics
dental.content:
Dental procedures create aerosol with potentially pathogenic microorganisms. Ozonation of operatories between patients ensures disinfection of air and all surfaces, reducing cross-infection risk.

Modern dentistry uses ozone not only for room disinfection but also therapeutically: caries cavity treatment, periodontal disease treatment, root canal disinfection.

Dental operatory ozonation after each patient takes 15–20 minutes and can be done during breaks. The gas penetrates hard-to-reach parts of equipment: hoses, handpieces, water lines.

Speed of treatment and absence of chemical odors after disinfection are especially important for dental clinics. Ozone decays to oxygen in 20–30 minutes, leaving a light fresh smell. Patients note a pleasant atmosphere.

intro.text: Dental procedures carry a high risk of infection transmission: aerosols from turbine handpieces, contact with blood and saliva, large numbers of patients daily. Ozonation provides rapid and effective office disinfection, as well as therapeutic applications.
intro.text2: In addition to room disinfection, ozone is actively used therapeutically: treatment of carious cavities, periodontal disease treatment, root canal disinfection. Ozone therapy is a recognized field of modern dentistry.

highlight1.title: Dentistry feature:
highlight1.text: When a turbine handpiece operates, fine aerosol containing bacteria and viruses from the patient's oral cavity is formed. This aerosol spreads throughout the office and settles on surfaces.

applications.title: Ozone applications in dentistry
items: Office disinfection between patient visits
Final office treatment at end of workday
Cleaning of water supply systems in dental units
Ozone therapy: caries treatment without drilling
Root canal treatment
Periodontal disease treatment
Disinfection of removable prostheses

disinfection.title: Dental office disinfection
disinfection.text: Ozonation allows rapid office disinfection during technical breaks between patients. In 15-20 minutes, ozone destroys pathogens on all surfaces and in the air.
disinfection.highlight: Ozone penetrates hard-to-reach equipment areas: hoses, handpieces, water supply systems — places where traditional wiping is impossible.

ozonotherapy.title: Ozone therapy in dentistry
ozonotherapy.text: Therapeutic use of ozone in dentistry is one of the most developed fields of ozone therapy. Ozone has pronounced bactericidal, antiviral and fungicidal effects.

features.title: Caries treatment
features.description: At early stages, ozone destroys bacteria and stops caries development without drilling

features.title: Canal treatment
features.description: Ozonated water and gas for root canal disinfection before filling

features.title: Periodontitis treatment
features.description: Ozone treatment of periodontal pockets reduces inflammation and destroys pathogens

features.title: Wound healing
features.description: Accelerated healing after tooth extraction, implantation, surgical interventions

waterSystems.title: Water supply system treatment
waterSystems.text: Biofilms — bacterial colonies including Legionella and Pseudomonas — form in dental unit pipelines. Ozonated water effectively destroys biofilms and disinfects the system.
items: Flushing ozonated water (2-3 mg/L) through system at end of day
Biofilm destruction on inner pipeline surfaces
Tank and filter disinfection
Improved water quality for irrigation

benefits.title: Benefits for dental clinics
items: Rapid office turnover — disinfection during breaks
Cross-infection prevention between patients
No chemical odors after treatment — patient comfort
Additional service — ozone therapy as modern treatment method
Compliance with dental clinic sanitary requirements
Reduced costs for disinfectants
benefits.highlight: Patients note pleasant office atmosphere after ozonation — fresh air without specific "hospital" odors. This increases loyalty and visit comfort.

rehabilitation.title: Rehabilitation centers
rehabilitation.heroText: Comprehensive use of ozone in sanatoriums and rehabilitation centers: ozone therapy for health recovery, pool and spa ozonation, disinfection of wards and procedure rooms.
rehabilitation.content:
Rehabilitation centers and sanatoriums use ozone in two ways: ozone therapy as a treatment and recovery method, and room ozonation to maintain sanitary standards.

Ozone therapy is used for musculoskeletal, cardiovascular and skin conditions. Methods include: ozone baths, subcutaneous injections, autohemotherapy with ozone, rectal insufflations.

Ozonation of wards and procedure rooms is especially important in centers where elderly patients and people with weakened immunity undergo rehabilitation. Ozone reduces the risk of respiratory infection spread between patients.

Pools, saunas and spa areas in rehabilitation centers are also treated with ozone. Pool water ozonation reduces chlorine demand, making procedures more comfortable for patients with sensitive skin.
benefits: Disinfection of wards and procedure rooms

intro.text: Rehabilitation centers and sanatoriums have unique requirements: on one hand, it is necessary to maintain high sanitary standards, on the other — to create a comfortable environment for patient recovery. Ozone solves both tasks.
intro.text2: Ozone therapy is a recognized field of physiotherapy used to treat a wide range of conditions. In parallel, ozone is used for room disinfection and pool water treatment, making it a universal solution for rehabilitation facilities.

highlight1.title: Comprehensive approach:
highlight1.text: In one center, ozone can be used for therapeutic procedures (ozone therapy), pool water treatment (water ozonation) and room disinfection (air ozonation). This optimizes costs and simplifies logistics.

ozonotherapy.title: Ozone therapy in rehabilitation
ozonotherapy.text: Ozone therapy is a physiotherapy method based on the therapeutic properties of medical ozone. Used for recovery after injuries, surgeries, and for chronic conditions.

features.title: Ozone baths
features.description: Ozone-saturated water has a general strengthening effect, improves blood circulation, relieves muscle tension

features.title: Subcutaneous injections
features.description: Introduction of ozone-oxygen mixture into trigger points to relieve pain and inflammation in joint diseases

features.title: Autohemotherapy
features.description: Enrichment of patient's blood with ozone followed by reinjection — systemic health effect

features.title: Rectal insufflations
features.description: Introduction of ozone-oxygen mixture for treatment of gastrointestinal diseases and general health improvement

methods.title: Ozone therapy methods and indications
methods.text: Various ozone therapy methods are used depending on indications and patient condition:

spa.title: SPA procedures with ozone
spa.text: Ozone is widely used in SPA areas of rehabilitation centers for wellness procedures:

steps.title: Ozone capsules
steps.description: Patient is placed in a capsule with ozonated air. Ozone penetrates through the skin, improving microcirculation and saturating tissues with oxygen.

steps.title: Hydromassage with ozonated water
steps.description: Ozonated water in a hydromassage tub has antiseptic properties and stimulates skin regeneration.

steps.title: Ozone shower
steps.description: Spraying the body with fine-dispersed ozonated water. Tones the skin, improves its condition in dermatological problems.

steps.title: Ozonated wraps
steps.description: Application of ozonated oil or cream followed by wrapping. Used for body contouring and cellulite treatment.

spa.highlight: SPA procedures with ozone are especially effective when combined with other rehabilitation methods: massage, physiotherapy, therapeutic exercise. A comprehensive approach accelerates recovery.

pools.title: Pool ozonation
pools.text: Pools in rehabilitation centers require a special approach to water treatment. Ozonation allows reducing chlorine content and creating comfortable conditions for patients:
items: 60-70% reduction in chlorine concentration — minimal skin and eye irritation
No chlorine odor — comfort for patients with respiratory diseases
Destruction of chlorine-resistant pathogens: cryptosporidia, giardia
Decomposition of chloramines — main cause of mucosal irritation
Improved water clarity — aesthetic comfort

disinfection.title: Room disinfection
disinfection.text: Ozonation of wards and procedure rooms is an important component of the sanitary regime in rehabilitation centers:
items: Ward disinfection between patient stays — complete treatment in 40-60 minutes
Procedure room treatment — elimination of cross-contamination
Ozonation of massage tables, exercise equipment, physiotherapy devices
Odor elimination in rooms — fresh air without chemical fragrances
Ventilation disinfection — reduced risk of respiratory infection spread
disinfection.warning: During room ozonation, patients and staff must leave the treated area. After treatment, ventilation is required until ozone concentration drops below MAC (0.1 mg/m³).

benefits.title: Benefits of ozone for rehabilitation centers

features.title: Comprehensive solution
features.description: One technological approach for therapy, water treatment and disinfection — cost optimization and staff training simplification

features.title: Patient comfort
features.description: Soft water without chlorine odor, clean air, pleasant atmosphere — positive stay experience

features.title: Medical effectiveness
features.description: Ozone therapy is a proven treatment method with a wide range of indications and minimal contraindications

features.title: Environmental friendliness
features.description: Ozone decomposes to oxygen without chemical residues — safe for patients and the environment

ambulances.title: Ambulances
ambulances.content:
Ambulances transport patients with various infectious diseases. Fast and effective disinfection between calls is critical to prevent infection spread.

Ambulance interior ozonation takes 20–30 minutes and ensures full disinfection of all surfaces: stretchers, equipment, handrails, floor, walls and ceiling. The gas penetrates seat upholstery and hard-to-reach areas.

Traditional wiping with disinfectants cannot achieve the same level of treatment as gas disinfection. Ozone reaches areas inaccessible to manual wiping and destroys pathogens in the air.

Mobile ozone generators for ambulances run from 12V or 24V vehicle power. Equipment is compact and can be stored in the cabin. After treatment, ventilate for 10–15 minutes. The vehicle is ready for the next call.
